main event: A pilot and copilot observed a silver grey cylinder-shaped object with a bright blue tail and trailing heavy yellow-orange sparks while flying at 32,500 feet on 23 March 1956.
interesting points: The object was compared to a V-5 rocket,The sighting lasted approximately seven seconds,The object changed shape and was described as having a teardrop silhouette,The object moved at high speed and disappeared after a bright flash of light,It was observed at a distance of 2-3 miles from the aircraft.
sighted object: a silver grey cylinder-shaped object with a blue tail
witness description: pilot and copilot of an aircraft
